intro: Drypetes glabridiscus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved drypetes, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by orange-red fruits that contain three seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated for landscaping and reforestation purposes.
